question: who caused to build qutub minar in delhi
chain_of_thought_result: The Qutub Minar in Delhi was commissioned by Qutb al-Din Aibak, the founder of the Delhi Sultanate, in 1193. He initiated the construction of the minaret to mark the victory over the last Hindu kingdom in Delhi and to serve as a minaret for the adjoining mosque, the Quwwat-ul-Islam Mosque. The construction was later completed by his successor, Iltutmish.
